title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" and pertains to conveyance vessels. The "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" allows the Secretary of Transportation to convey two vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations operating Liberty Ships or Victory Ships as memorials. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. Organizations must enter into an agreement before receiving the vessels. The organization must sell the vessel for scrap, use the proceeds to refurbish a memorial ship, and return any unused funds to the United States. Amounts returned will be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary will deliver each vessel. The Secretary will deliver each vessel conveyed under this section at its current location and condition without cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers, such as ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, and JULIET. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers include JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, and PLAY PRETTY. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers include PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, TESSA, TOP DUCK, VIKING, and WHIT CON TIKI. These vessels are subject to certain laws, including restrictions on foreign-flag vessels. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsement, despite certain laws restricting foreign-flag vessels. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard costing more than 3 times its purchase value before June 30, 1995, and if the person documenting the vessel contracts with a US shipyard to build an additional vessel within 12 months. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with specific endorsements for vessels REEL CLASS and DA WARRIOR, bypassing certain regulations. The vessels UST ATLANTIC and UST PACIFIC can be sold to non-US citizens and placed under a foreign registry. The vessel AMY CHOUEST is considered less than 500 gross tons for US maritime laws. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
